text: Impaired cytokine production by cpdm BMDC is correlated with selective defects in NF-kappaB signaling

There are a number of possible explanations for the defective cytokine secretion in stimulated cpdm BMDC , including 1 ) reduced surface expression of the LPS receptor complex , 2 ) increased production of anti-inflammatory mediators , 3 ) increased expression of negative regulators of TLR pathways , and 4 ) impaired TLR - induced signaling activation .

We determined the surface expression of the LPS receptor complex that comprises <extra_id_0> TLR4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , the accessory proteins <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> myeloid differentiation factor 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> MD2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> LY96 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) [ 19 ] .

Flow cytometric analysis shows that the expression levels of <extra_id_0> CD14 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> TLR4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> MD2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> between WT and cpdm BMDC were similar ( Fig . 5A ) .
